poem:
Certainty  

worn papers  
clutched tight,  
lines drawn  
in ink—  
seeking truth  
in shadows  
of ballots,  
where whispers  
of identity  
clink against  
the machinery  
of choice.  

Let us  
hold  
these fragile  
scraps—  
the hope  
of being heard  
fluttering  
beneath  
a heavy seal.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Republicans in many states forge ahead with bills requiring proof of citizenship to vote Republicans in nearly half of state legislatures have proposed bills to require documentary proof of citizenship to vote. Conservatives in California are pushing for a voter ID ballot measure that would require citizenship verification to register to vote and photo identification to get a ballot. A Republican lawmaker in Pennsylvania filed a bill to create a voter ID in the swing". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Republicans in many states forge ahead with bills requiring proof of citizenship to vote Republicans in nearly half of state legislatures have proposed bills to require documentary proof of citizenship to vote. Conservatives in California are pushing for a voter ID ballot measure that would require citizenship verification to register to vote and photo identification to get a ballot. A Republican lawmaker in Pennsylvania filed a bill to create a voter ID in the swing
